file_content.text: House Thul will lead the drive to force the Killiks underground. We will have a clean planet again.
The Killik hives have been poisoned. They'll swarm soon.
And the noble houses must accept their obligation to combat them, thanks to Thul leadership.
In another life, you would have made a fine royal Guardian of the Mounds.
Seize Organa's xenotoxins and poison the Killik hives. Thul will not ignore the infestation taking place.
Imagine leaving your home for a sojourn into the galaxy. When you return, you find the manor infested.
The wood is rotten and wriggling; beetles carpet floors you raced across as a child, and maggots drop in tangled clumps onto your head.
With due respect, my lord, this is what House Thul faces--an infestation of vermin.
This is what House Thul must contend with--an infestation of vermin.
The Sith returned from exile to a galaxy overrun with Jedi.
The Empire faces vermin, too.
Then you understand. Though our infestation is of a more literal kind.
Thousands of eyes hiding in the dark, terrifying the unwary... what's not to like?
I like insects.
Our exile was to stark and sterile places; perhaps I never developed your proclivities.
When you have a bug problem, you hire an exterminator.
There's an obvious solution...
The Killiks--insectoid aliens here on Alderaan. They're causing problems?
I've heard of the infestation.
Yes--barely intelligent things. It's the nobility's obligation to contain the swarms underground.
I'm not following you.
So exterminate them.
You can squash one, but not a million.
The Killiks are Alderaan's native insectoid population. Man-sized, barely intelligent, it's the nobility's duty to contain the swarms underground.
Unchecked, they are ravaging this planet, turning palaces into hives and cocooning the survivors... generations caught in the mandibles of beasts.
We can't have that.
You said they're native to this world. They were here first...?
Where do the bugs come from?
These things frighten you.
Legend has it Killiks once ruled the planet. Supposedly, most flew to the stars--but how many remained in hibernation?
House Organa has been neglecting their responsibilities against the vermin, but even they carry defenses against Killik hunting parties.
If you could seize the Organa toxins and poison the Killik hives, well... the Killiks will swarm, and the other houses must defend themselves and do their part.
A smart trick--I like it.
Maybe Alderaan belongs to the Killiks as much as it does to you.
Maybe they belong here.
No Alderaanian is so naive. Bug hunting, however inglorious, is our obligation--and Organa and Ulgo have failed Alderaan.
We will all war against the Killiks--and Thul will save this planet from infestation.
Not interested. [Refuse quest]
Not interested. [Refuse quest]
Spoken like so many Ulgos and Organas.
Have you seen the Killiks? They eat men alive, you know.
